item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Console Specs Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/kingdom-come-deliverance-2-console-specs-revealed/

Warhorse Studios has revealed the console specs for Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2. The specs look at the game’s target performance and any upscaling available on the Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X, PlayStation 5, and PlayStation 5 Pro.

Check out the full target specs for the game below. It’s worth noting that any target that is “unlocked with VRR” requires an HDMI 2.1 cable and compatible display. If you are playing on PC, check out what you’ll need for the best performance.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Console Specs

Xbox Series S

  • Resolution: 1080p
  • Target Performance: 30 FPS
  • Upscaling Technology: None

Xbox Series X (Performance Mode)

  • Resolution: Upscaled 1440p
  • Target Performance: 60 FPS (unlocked with VRR)
  • Upscaling Technology: AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution

Xbox Series X (Fidelity Mode)

  • Resolution: Upscaled 2160p
  • Target Performance: 30 FPS
  • Upscaling Technology: AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution

PlayStation 5 (Performance Mode)

  • Resolution: Upscaled 1440p
  • Target Performance: 60 FPS (unlocked with VRR)
  • Upscaling Technology: AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution

PlayStation 5 (Fidelity Mode)

  • Resolution: Upscaled 2160p
  • Target Performance: 30 FPS
  • Upscaling Technology: AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution

PlayStation 5 Pro

  • Resolution: Upscaled 2160p
  • Target Performance: 60 FPS (unlocked with VRR)
  • Upscaling Technology: PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 launches on February 4, 2025 for Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and PC.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what fighter is heading to Undisputed boxing as DLC. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 PC Specs Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/kingdom-come-deliverance-2-pc-specs-revealed/

The full PC specs for Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 have been revealed by developer Warhorse Studios. The reveal comes two months ahead of the game’s launch on February 4.

Check out the full specs list below for various resolutions. If you are playing on console, check out those specs based on your system.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 PC Specs

Minimum – Low (1080p @ 30 FPS)

  • Processor: Intel Core i5-8400 / AMD Ryzen 5 2600
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 (6GB) / AMD Radeon RX 580
  • Storage: 100 GB SSD
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (or newer)

Recommended 1080p – Medium (1080p @ 60 FPS)

  • Processor: Intel Core i5-13600K / AMD Ryzen 5 7600X
  • Memory: 24 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 / AMD Radeon RX 6600 XT
  • Storage: 100 GB SSD
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (or newer)

Recommended 1440p – Medium (1440p @ 60 FPS)

  • Processor: Intel Core i5-13600K / AMD Ryzen 5 7600X
  • Memory: 24 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti / AMD Radeon RX 6700 XT
  • Storage: 100 GB SSD
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (or newer)

Recommended 1080p – High (1080p @ 30 FPS)

  • Processor: Intel Core i5-12600K / AMD Ryzen 7 5800X
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060 SUPER / AMD Radeon RX 5700
  • Storage: 100 GB SSD
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (or newer)

Recommended 1440p – High (1440p @ 60 FPS)

  • Processor: Intel Core i7-13700K / AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 / AMD Radeon RX 7800 XT
  • Storage: 100 GB SSD
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (or newer)

Best – Ultra (1440p @ 60 FPS or 2160p @ 30 FPS)

  • Processor: Intel Core i7-13700K / AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 / AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT
  • Storage: 100 GB SSD

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 launches on February 4 for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the first details of the first ever turn-based Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Tactical Takedown Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-tactical-takedown-announced/

There is a new Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (TMNT) game is on the way. Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Tactical Takedown is a turn-based strategy game from developer Strange Scaffold, the team behind El Paso, Elsewhere, Clickolding, and I Am Your Beast.

The first turn-based TMNT game, Tactical Takedown follows what happens after both Splinter and Shredder pass away where a new leader has taken over the Foot Clan. The single-player game features 20 levels that are divided into campaigns that each focus on a single character. Each of the levels will also mutate as the turns pass.

Tactical Takedown features a graphic novel art style with figurines and diorama set pieces. There will also be customizable movesets for each of the Turtles to shape the game how you’d like.

“This is the next step for Michelangelo, Donatello, Leonardo, and Raphael,” the game’s description reads. “…as the Turtles approach adulthood, they’re not just growing up… they’re growing apart.”

A release date will be announced at a later date, but it is available to wishlist on Steam, now. You can check out the trailer for the game below.

What do you think of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Tactical Takedown? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.
